title: The Economist’s Guide to Parenting: 10 Years Later (Ep. 479 Replay)
description: In one of the earliest Freakonomics Radio episodes, we asked a bunch of economists with young kids how they approached child-rearing. Now the kids are old enough to talk — and they have a lot to say. We hear about nature vs. nurture, capitalism vs. Marxism, and why you don’t tell your friends that your father is an economist.
author: editor@freakonomics.com (Freakonomics Radio + Stitcher)
